member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.ThrottlingTransmissionPolicy.PauseDuration
member.summary: Gets a value that determines amount of time transmission sending will be paused before attempting to resume transmission after a network error is detected.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.TransmissionExtensions.LoadAsync(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Loads a new transmission from the specified .
member.returns: Return transmission loaded from file; return null if the file is corrupted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.TransmissionExtensions.SaveAsync(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.Transmission,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Saves the transmission to the specified .

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel
member.summary: Represents a communication channel for sending telemetry to Application Insights via HTTP/S.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.Dispose
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.Send(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Channel.ITelemetry)
member.summary: Sends an instance of ITelemetry through the channel.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.Flush
member.summary: Will send all the telemetry items stored in the memory.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.Initialize(Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Extensibility.TelemetryConfiguration)
member.summary: Initialize method is called after all configuration properties have been loaded from the configuration.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.DeveloperMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether developer mode of telemetry transmission is enabled. When developer mode is True, sends telemetry to Application Insights immediately during the entire lifetime of the application. When developer mode is False, respects production sending policies defined by other properties.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.EndpointAddress
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP address where the telemetry is sent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.DataUploadIntervalInSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum telemetry batching interval. Once the interval expires, serializes the accumulated telemetry items for transmission.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.MaxTelemetryBufferCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of telemetry items will accumulate in a memory before the serializing them for transmission to Application Insights.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.MaxTransmissionBufferCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory, in bytes, that will use to buffer transmissions before sending them to Application Insights.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.MaxTransmissionSenderCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of telemetry transmissions that will send to Application Insights at the same time.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TelemetryChannel.MaxTransmissionStorageCapacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of disk space, in bytes, that will use to store unsent telemetry transmissions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TransmissionBuffer.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of memory in bytes for buffering objects.
member.remarks: Use this property to limit the amount of memory used to store telemetry in memory of the application before transmission. Once the maximum amount of memory is reached, will reject new transmissions.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TransmissionBuffer.Size
member.summary: Gets the combined length of stored in the buffer.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TransmissionSender.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the the maximum number of objects that can be sent simultaneously.
member.remarks: Use this property to limit the number of concurrent HTTP connections. Once the maximum number of transmissions in progress is reached, will stop accepting new transmissions until previous transmissions are sent.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.TransmissionStorage.Capacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the total amount of disk space, in bytes, allowed for storing transmission files.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.Transmitter
member.summary: Implements throttled and persisted transmission of telemetry to Application Insights.
Initializes a new instance of the class. Used only for UTs.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Web.Channel.Transmitter.Flush
member.summary: Persist the in-memory telemetry items.

member.summary: Encapsulates platform-specific behavior of network information APIs.

member.summary: Adds event handler.
member.remarks: Defined as a method instead of an event in this interface because C# compiler changes signature of event in a Windows Runtime component, making it very hard to implement properly.

member.summary: Encapsulates platform-specific behavior of network information APIs.

member.summary: Unregisters the from .

member.name: M:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Extensibility.Web.WebApplicationLifecycle.Stop(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets called by when the web application is stopping.
member.param: False when the method is invoked first time, allowing async shutdown operations. True when the method is invoked second time, demanding to unregister immediately.

member.name: E:Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Extensibility.Web.WebApplicationLifecycle.Started
member.summary: The event is raised when the instance is first created. This event is not raised for web applications.
